p: How might these principles be realized in practice? The challenge is stark. By 2030, annual emissions need to be 28 GtCO2e lower than current unconditional Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs) for the 1.5 °C goal and 13 GtCO2e lower for the 2 °C goal (UNEP 2021). Figure 1 shows the implications of these levels of emissions cuts for the carbon intensity of the global economy under a range of growth scenarios.
